result.execSummary:
The defendant James E Dixon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Progrm.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 1000 days sentence credit.

AS OF 11-15-2017: Court grants ZERO days credit for duplicate credit in Ozaukee Co Case, Per DOC.
Concurrent with: Ozaukee County Case 15CF11 and Count 3 of this Case.
AND any other case.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution is ordered to be paid joint/several with the Co-actors as follows:  $443.41 payable to victim (D. B.), $2,979.64 payable to victim (C. C.), $2,159.64 payable to victim (C. S.) and $666.19 payable to Allied Insurance.  Restitution is to be paid as a Condition of The Sentence and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines/surcharges.
AMENDED 06/15/2018 COURT MODIFIES THE RESTITUTION TO $2,979.64 (for Christen S.); $443.41 (for Dennis B.) and $666.19 for Allied Insurance FOR A TOTAL OF $4,089.24

Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with any of the victims (or their residence) or Co-Actors.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt:
Letter dated November 8, 2017 filed by Department of Corrections requesting the Court review the sentence credit granted on the Judgment of Conviction; some or all of the credit appears to be duplicate credit.

11/14/17 - Court reviewed and granted Dept of Corrections request; Amended J.O.C. to be prepared amending sentence credit due.

Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant James E Dixon in court, in custody (OTP'd From Prairie Du Chien Correctional), with attorney Jeffrey John Szczewski.  

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.


Court orders the following:
Count 2:
Total Prison:  10 Years.
Initial Confinement:  5 Years.
Extended Supervision:  5 Years.
Concurrent to: Ozaukee County Case 15CF11 and count 3.
1000 Days Credit.
  
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  any of the victims (or their residence) or Co-Actor.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

RESTITUTION:  $6,248.88 Joint/Several with Co-Actors. 
(Breakdown:  $443.41 to victim (D.B.); $2,979.64 to victim (C.C.); $2,159.64 to victim (C.S.) and $666.19 Allied Insurance - to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.







Count 3:
Total Prison:  10 Years.
Initial Confinement:  5 Years.
Extended Supervision:  5 Years.
Concurrent to: Ozaukee County Case 15CF11 and count 2.
1000 Days Credit.
  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Same as Count 2.

Costs:  $268
DNA Surcharge:  $250
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
